content:
Sure, here are some additional questions to help discern the amount of virtual trainers vs conventional training:

1. How much of the training program will be conducted using virtual trainers?
2. What is the proportion of virtual trainers to conventional training methods, such as in-person instruction?
3. Will trainees have access to both virtual trainers and conventional training methods, or will the training be exclusively virtual?
4. How will the effectiveness of the virtual trainers be measured against conventional training methods?
5. What are the benefits and drawbacks of virtual trainers compared to conventional training methods?
6. Are there any limitations to using virtual trainers that need to be considered?
7. How will trainees be able to interact with instructors during virtual training sessions?
8. What kind of feedback mechanisms will be available for trainees during virtual training sessions?
9. How will trainees be able to practice hands-on skills using virtual trainers?
10. Will there be any differences in cost between virtual trainers and conventional training methods?
